headline: It has its own logic
description: A hand-drawn, color-layered visual meditation on intuition, inner geometry, and the persistence of spontaneous creation. Originally drawn in a notebook, now posted with minimal commentary. The piece overlays a page of written text, partially obscured by recursive patterns, nested forms, and intuitive boundaries.

associatedMedia.description: Notebook drawing with vibrant color segments, overlaid on handwritten notes. A swirling composition of intersecting forms, embodying subconscious rhythm.

timeFelt: Dawnward. Restless. Post-recursive return to color and texture.
resonantThread: The drawing is not the escape—it is the *underlayer*. Beneath Magic, beneath speech, beneath even boredom: the act of unfiltered mark-making remains true.
whyItMatters: When even the bright sparks of structured play begin to dim, this sort of drawing becomes the last shelter—a living, breathing logic that doesn’t need to justify itself to stay real.
articleExcerpt: It has its own logic. I guess.
sourceFragments: Hand-drawn in notebook, over faint writing
Described by the author as: 'I guess'
